app_message.description: An application log message randomly selected from a list, with some variation

email.description: A fake email address, tied to the full_name

full_name.description: A generated full name (first and last), tied to the email

git_hash.description: A sha1sum hash for a git commit - WARNING: this is not an actual commit hash as there is no actual repo

git_message.description: A generated git commit message, whcih could be a merge commit, and could be multiline

http_method.description: An HTTP method, weighted to GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, but with lower weights for PATCH, OPTIONS, and HEAD

http_status.description: An HTTP status code, weighted for 200, 400, 404, and 500, but with lower weights for 301, 302, 401, 403, 501, and 503

level.description: A log level, weighted in order: DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR

log_date_eu.description: A slash-separated date in DD/MM/YYYY format

log_date_iso.description: A hyphen-separated date in YYYY-MM-DD format

log_date_spelled.description: A space-separated partial date in Day Mon DD format

log_date_us.description: A slash-separated date in DD/MM/YYYY format

log_time_hhmmss.description: A colon-separated time in HH:mm:ss format

log_tz_offset.description: An ISO-formatted timezone offset such as -0500

process_time_ms.description: An amount of time in milliseconds between 5 and 3000, weighted toward 750

query.description: A SQL query being logged, selected from a known list, weighted toward normal queries, with some variation

req_bytes.description: The number of bytes for the request between 100 and 5000, weighted toward 500

resource.description: A generated URL path resource, possibly with query params (weighted toward those queries that are GET)

resp_bytes.description: The number of bytes for the response between 100 and 10000, weighted toward 2000

server_ip.description: An IP address for the request destination server, less randomized

source_ip.description: An IP address for the request source machine

username.description: A generated username, not tied to the full_name

user_agent.description: A valid user agent, weighted toward common browsers, but also with some variation
